situation: An irrigation canal with trapezoidal cross-section has the following dimensions: Bottom width = 2.50 m, depth of water = 0.90 m, side slope = 1.5 horizontal to 1 vertical, slope of the canal bed = 0.001, coefficient of roughness = 0.025. The canal will serve clay-loam Riceland for which the duty of water per hectare is 3.0 liters/sec. Using Manningâ€™s Formula:

subquestions.question: Determine the hydraulic radius of the canal, in meters.
Compute the velocity of water in m/s.
Determine the number of hectares served by the irrigation canal.
